635901702.name: birds museum
635901702.author: a TripAdvisor user
635901702.reviewBody:
A place with a great variety of bird species.
Un lugar con una gran variedad de especies de aves.

It Worth to visit

594604360.name: Renovated and amazing showings
594604360.author: a TripAdvisor user
594604360.reviewBody: I have been here for a couple of times before (around 16 and 12 years ago) and it was an OK museum, but on April 2018 I took my husband and was expecting being his translator (since I speak both English and Spanish), but I was surprised when I realized that all the information and data in the museum was in both languages! Hallelujah! So I had the chance to enjoy the museum too. And also since the last time I have being here, the place has being renovated and with new content, new species and really looks great! Loved it. Also you can have a guided tour (I believe only in Spanish) by volunteer kids. We went on a Thursday afternoon and wasn\'t crowded at all. Also I don\'t meant to be a spoiler, lol but they have a couple of live bird species that will amaze you after the tour.

561087678.name: Amazing if you love birds
561087678.author: a TripAdvisor user
561087678.reviewBody: This displays and information in the museum were really great! I went here at the beginning of my trip around the country and it helped me to identify birds. There were some great interactive sections with bird song, I wish this was in my home town.

503590580.name: One of a kind
503590580.author: a TripAdvisor user
503590580.reviewBody: This is a one of a kind museum. The building was originally a convent, an nun\'s school next to a beautiful church (San Juan).\nThe permanent collection holds stuffed birds so it is easy to appreciate them.

479584290.name: Fantastic exhibits!
479584290.author: a TripAdvisor user
479584290.reviewBody: Really well done museum! Lots of different kinds of birds and tons of different information about the evolution of birds. Exhibits are both in Spanish and English so it\'s a great place if you don\'t speak much Spanish.

475965493.name: Above expectations!
475965493.author: a TripAdvisor user
475965493.reviewBody: We planned to attend Museo del Desierto. However, since it was holiday, it was crowded. So, we decided to go to Museo de la Aves. It was beyond my expectations, it is not expensive. The collections and displays are awesome. It is a must-see in Saltillo.

447032811.name: 6 yr old daughter asked for a 2nd visit
447032811.author: a TripAdvisor user
447032811.reviewBody: Went with my wife and 6 year old daughter. Very nice display. Our 6 year old daughter asked us to take her again after lunch.

446064977.name: The museum of the bird
446064977.author: a TripAdvisor user
446064977.reviewBody: This musueum has the biggest collection of bird in the whole country, it also shows and integrates the respect for the local birds, visitors need to understand that the museun is a quite place

362399159.name: I Love This Place
362399159.author: a TripAdvisor user
362399159.reviewBody: They have a wonderful teaching program.  They have rally fine displays and dioramas.  I just wish they would finish their renovations.  It\'s been  years now

286601246.name: Great concert hall, creepy museum.
286601246.author: a TripAdvisor user
286601246.reviewBody: Creepy but cool. Old but quiche. Admiring dead birds is Not my favorite thing to do, BUT do not miss any classical music concert in the tiny hall at the entrance. The accoustic is great and most of the musicians are truly amazing.

268424278.name: If you like birds excellent
268424278.author: a TripAdvisor user
268424278.reviewBody: Good place to visit.  There are kids who explain the exhibit, and it make more fun the tour.  It is didacticc, and has the exact amount of things that you don,t, get tired.

262029177.name: Great older museum
262029177.author: a TripAdvisor user
262029177.reviewBody: Completely recommend it if you are running out of things to do.  Very well set up.  Older style of museum.

237900020.name: museo de las aves
237900020.author: a TripAdvisor user
237900020.reviewBody: absolutely stunning museum.  so many birds, even if you are an ornithologist, you learn and see new birds.  the exshibits are beautiful.  worth a visit.

210019988.name: Mesmorized by the quetzalcoatl bird
210019988.author: a TripAdvisor user
210019988.reviewBody: This is one of the many museums Saltillo has. I went there when I first moved to Saltillo and I found it to be a nice relaxed place. There are many birds specimen on display. I fell in love with the quetzalcoatl bird which I never knew existed until I saw it here. If you go to the garden outside, you may be lucky enough to see some hummingbirds. I\'ve never been so close to them so I was very excited about that.

178377580.name: Great place for kids
178377580.author: a TripAdvisor user
178377580.reviewBody: If your kids love animals, is a great place to take them. Used to be a private collection now is a museum

169666114.name: Birds Museum
169666114.author: a TripAdvisor user
169666114.reviewBody: You are able there to see many different birds that go from the samllest to the highest, parking lot facilities, whellchair too

156293702.name: unique museum in interesting building
156293702.author: a TripAdvisor user
156293702.reviewBody: unique in the world, this museum boasts a specimen of every bird that can be found in mexico. very well laid out, it is in a interesting old building with a beautiful courtyard where events are frequently held.

132197619.name: good enough
132197619.author: a TripAdvisor user
132197619.reviewBody: A colleague and I wanted to kill a couple of hours so we decided to visit. Its good enough to kill a couple of hours if you are already in downtown Saltillo. If you are an out of town guest, they discount the already cheap entrance fee to under a dollar.

127777648.name: Unique!
127777648.author: a TripAdvisor user
127777648.reviewBody: A splendid collection of Mexican birds... Learn about their habitats, their reproduction, their physical characteristics... This, in a nice building and calm environment...

332803913.name: A Piece of Nature in the Heart of the City
332803913.author: a TripAdvisor user
332803913.reviewBody:
After exploring downtown, take a break on a bench in the Alameda Zaragoza.  Enjoy an ice cream while people watching.  Take kids to play on the playground.  Sit in the shade on the talavera-tiled benches by the Frog Fountain.  Read a book in the library.  Gaze on the statues, tree carvings, and fountains.  

If one visits in November, the Alameda is a favorite resting place for the monarch butterflies on their annual migration from Canada to Michoacan.  

And there are free, (usually) clean, public restrooms!

634703178.name: Bello lugar hist\u00f3rico
634703178.author: a TripAdvisor user
634703178.reviewBody: Un  templo del siglo XVIII, hermoso, imponente y sobrio, fundado por religiosos de la Compa\u00f1\u00eda de Jes\u00fas. Contiene valiosas pinturas y vitrales; es parte del tesoro cultural de Saltillo. Se localiza en el centro de la ciudad, a dos cuadras de la catedral y de la Plaza de Armas.

627302584.name: De las iglesias mas antiguas y bonitas de Saltillo
627302584.author: a TripAdvisor user
627302584.reviewBody: De las iglesias mas bonitas y antiguas de la ciudad y del estado, el edifici\u00f3 es muy bonito por fuera y por dentro, muy amplio, adem\u00e1s est\u00e1 en pleno centro e la ciudad. muy cerca de la catedral as\u00ed se matan dos p\u00e1jaron de un solo tiro !

619017190.name: Bello Templo Cat\u00f3lico
619017190.author: a TripAdvisor user
619017190.reviewBody: Bella arquitectura Neocl\u00e1sica. Bonitas pinturas ejecutadas por religiosos de la Compa\u00f1ia de Jes\u00fas a finales del siglo XVIII y no dejes de observar los vitrales.

609388762.name: Bonito interior de esta iglesia catolica
609388762.author: a TripAdvisor user
609388762.reviewBody: Esta iglesia ubicada a media cuadra del Museo de las Aves tiene un altar bello y su \u00f3rgano que es usado durante las misas suena muy bien.

562753878.name: HERMOSA
562753878.author: a TripAdvisor user
562753878.reviewBody: Me quede sorprendido,hermosa iglesia en saltillo, sin duda la volver\u00eda a visitar, al igual que su catedral.

551624700.name: Hermosa!
551624700.author: a TripAdvisor user
551624700.reviewBody: Es muy bonita por dentro, tiene decoraciones que te dejan sorprendido. El \u00f3rgano (instrumento musical) todav\u00eda funciona. Es muy buena opci\u00f3n para boda religiosa.

538618915.name: Una iglesia bonita
538618915.author: a TripAdvisor user
538618915.reviewBody: Iglesia jesuita muy bonita por fuera! Sobria por dentro!! Hubo una graduaci\u00f3n por lo que estaba iluminada. Su mayordomo muy amable y explicando con detalle hasta las pinturas laterales.

511014824.name: HERMOSAAAAA
511014824.author: a TripAdvisor user
511014824.reviewBody: Es una de las iglesias mas atiguas de la ciudad y una de las mas bellas despues de la Catedral... tiene unas grandes pinturas en sus paredes  y en un clasico ejemplar de la arquitectura religiosa de la colonia.

508881548.name: Vale la pena visitarla
508881548.author: a TripAdvisor user
508881548.reviewBody: Es una de las mejores iglesias con las q cuenta saltillo, su decoraci\u00f3n es hermosa, un poco oscura pero vale la pena visitarla . Est\u00e1 muy cerca de catedral y plaza de armas. A un lado se encuentra el museo de las aves .

505983289.name: BELLO TEMPLO
505983289.author: a TripAdvisor user
505983289.reviewBody: Asist\u00ed a una boda. l templo tiene 2 naves paralelas y lo curioso es que la entrada principal esta por un atrio lateral que tiene ya que la puerta frontal esta directamente sobre la banqueta, lo cual es incomodo.\nEl altar es muy bonito, y la arquitectura en general data de la \u00e9poca de la colonia.

504740008.name: Chiesa gesuita molto bella
504740008.author: a TripAdvisor user
504740008.reviewBody: Una chiesa di conclamata origine gesuita con una facciata esterna ricca ma molto rovinata. L\'interno si sviluppa su una navata centrale ed una laterale. Bella la chiesa e interessante l\'altare. Molto interessante il piano rialzato che si raggiunge tramite una scaletta e che permette l\'accesso a due organi di notevole fattura e a una vista meritevole sulla chiesa dall\'alto.

589763807.name: If you\'re only going to visit one museum in downtown Saltillo, this is it!
589763807.author: a TripAdvisor user
589763807.reviewBody:
Saltillo is known for it's sarapes.  They're the symbol of the city--and they're quite a symbol for Mexico, too!  The Sarape Museum explains the history of the sarape (how it has both Spanish and indigenous roots), the traditional process of making them, and the presence of sarapes in popular culture.  The museum includes a well-curated display of sarapes that are, on average, 100 years old.  

The other half of the museum is devoted to Mexican traditional dress.  A priceless collection was donated to the museum, and now it's on display for all to enjoy.  It begins showing traditional indigenous dress from groups all over Mexico (but mainly from the southern states, where some communities still wear traditional clothing on a daily basis).  The next case displays how Spanish and native styles were fused, resulting in the traditional dresses from the Yucatan peninsula and Gulf coast areas.  Finally, the last group showcases traditional clothing from Coahuila, both indigenous and mestizo--not forgetting the matlachines that dance in front of churches on every saint's day in this region!  

It's a compact museum.  A visit could take up to an hour (if one really dawdles), but could take much less time.  And if time is limited, it's possible to cruise through the museum fairly quickly, guilt-free, because the museum is free to the public!  

But really, it is worth taking time to enjoy the expositions.  Despite being small, this is an excellent museum.

itemReviewed.name: Museo del Sarape y Trajes Mexicanos

address.streetAddress: Calle Ignacio Allende sur Zona Centro 160 Zona Centro

354439334.name: Well kept and beautifully displayed!
354439334.author: a TripAdvisor user
354439334.reviewBody:
An exquisite and unique display of sarape and other mexican costumes which are more than hundred. The museum is clean and the displays are well explained. There are videos also in the rooms explaining the history of sarape.
It also explains how the sarape is made...
Worth a visit to this art which is disappearing so fast!

itemReviewed.name: Museo del Sarape y Trajes Mexicanos

657439242.name: It Was Fine, I Wasn\'t Blown Away or Anything
657439242.author: a TripAdvisor user
657439242.reviewBody: It\'s free.  Reasonably well laid out.  Pleasantly presented.  Everything\'s in Spanish so, if you don\'t "habla" then no real point in going other than to look at old clothes and pictures.

306736369.name: Museum with Media
306736369.author: a TripAdvisor user
306736369.reviewBody: Only on Spanish :-\\\nEasy to locate by the sign outside. \nThey display the means if the early Mexican revulsion towards independence.

302679938.name: Fun spot!
302679938.author: a TripAdvisor user
302679938.reviewBody: Very informative and a very modern, interactive museum. It\'s free so it\'s a good value. It is not very big so it won\'t take too long, plus is right near downtown so you\'ll likely be in the area.

639300794.name: Catedral de Santiago, Saltillo
639300794.author: a TripAdvisor user
639300794.reviewBody: This is a spectacular Catholic Cathedral in Saltillo, Mexico.  It\'s architecture is quite ornate.  If you are fortunate to visit for the Festival de Santo Cristo, the plaza in front is full of activity!  If you are able to take a tour of the bell tower, the view is fantastic!!

621332138.name: Satillo, Coahuila, Mexico
621332138.author: a TripAdvisor user
621332138.reviewBody: Saltillo is a charming, modern city but still retains the Colonial ambiance. Lots of interesting places to visit and friendly people throughout the city. I will visit again...

612142852.name: Absolutely highly recommend
612142852.author: a TripAdvisor user
612142852.reviewBody: It is a beautiful church, with an enormous alter and evening service for pilgrims. The alter is extremely elaborate both for the main church and the side chapel. It is currently under repair but the scaffolding is mainly on the outside.

576165272.name: Beautiful landmark
576165272.author: a TripAdvisor user
576165272.reviewBody: This is a must vist lamdmark for anyone visiting Saltillo. Its elegant style stands out in the middle of the colonial area of the city. It\u2019s beautiful and worth a visit.

575651224.name: beautiful!!
575651224.author: a TripAdvisor user
575651224.reviewBody: This is a place where you have to visit if you come to Saltillo.  Its beautiful inside and outside and its walking distance from local restaurants.

562515792.name: Architectural Masterpiece
562515792.author: a TripAdvisor user
562515792.reviewBody: A fully functioning 18th century cathedral in the center of the city. Several richly decorated chapels within this amazing structure. Definitely a must-see on a tour of the city.

558319812.name: Interesting architecture, want to see again
558319812.author: a TripAdvisor user
558319812.reviewBody: Got to see the cathedral in Saltillo.  Very old Spanish style, in the square across from city hall.  I have seen many cathedral s and church\'s in Spain and other parts of Europe, including ones from the same time period (early 1500\'s) but the architecture of this building is much different, and somehow distinctly Mexican.  Unfortunately it was closed for the evening and I only got to see the outside.  I would like to return and see the interior.

556341679.name: Must see
556341679.author: a TripAdvisor user
556341679.reviewBody: This place is amazing. Able to catch end of service.  I love these classic churches. So much history and great architecture

546684614.name: Beautiful Church
546684614.author: a TripAdvisor user
546684614.reviewBody: If you\u2019re in Saltillo, make it a point to visit this beautiful church. It\u2019s massive and impressive! There is a small church and the large cathedral on the site. Attention to detail on statues and paintings that have survived so long here. Really nice!

505392423.name: Beautiful!
505392423.author: a TripAdvisor user
505392423.reviewBody: Saltillo\'s cathedral sits right off of the main plaza and government palace. Take a few minutes to stroll around and get away from the stifiling heat outside!

505301520.name: If You\'re in Saltillo, Why Not?
505301520.author: a TripAdvisor user
505301520.reviewBody:
When in Saltillo, there are 2 things to see: museo de desierto and Plaza de Armas. This Cathedral is in the latter of those. Right across from the Palacio de Gobierno. 

We visited on Sunday and really enjoy seeing this church. It is really imposing from the outside, lots of detail, and the rock has kind of a beautiful pinkish grey hue to it. 

The inside, I believe, has beautiful black marble floors however the rest of it (although beautiful) is less decorated than other Colonial Mexican Churches. 

Outside there was a small market (On Sunday when we were there) with some cool little trinkets, clothing, and snacks.

503589286.name: Great landmark
503589286.author: a TripAdvisor user
503589286.reviewBody: This is a must-see in Saltillo. The Cathedral is one of the largest in northern Mexico and it has been built in various stages. You can see the different materials in the construction (stone -clay- and adobe), also the front door is impressive. The construction is mostly baroque with lots of details

500970891.name: A beutifull catedral. Is in one of the sides of the main plaza in Saltillo which is la plaza de Armas.
500970891.author: a TripAdvisor user
500970891.reviewBody: You should visit in the morning and at night. The festivities during the 5 of August are very special to see.

488696582.name: Beautiful church in the heart of the city
488696582.author: a TripAdvisor user
488696582.reviewBody: This is an active church in the typical style of more than 1 church together. The location is a good point to start discovering the city and it is situated on one of the pretty town squares.

487226582.name: Nice Cathedral
487226582.author: a TripAdvisor user
487226582.reviewBody: During a  trip to downtown, we had chance for a short visit to this historical place. \nIt was a function and I was not able to go in for a long. For what I could see uch better from outside than inside, however I would recommend to ask info or a local guide for better details.

484922587.name: Very pretty
484922587.author: a TripAdvisor user
484922587.reviewBody: The church is really pretty, A friend got married there because of that. The problem is that they dont have Air Conditioner

446343148.name: The Catedral of the North
446343148.author: a TripAdvisor user
446343148.reviewBody: Maybe there are bigger churches in Mexico, but this is the tallest one, and it has some Baroque design that is breathaking, the paintings and the safety of the location makes it an obligated stop for the foreigners

446159633.name: Beautiful Cathedral
446159633.author: a TripAdvisor user
446159633.reviewBody: This is an incredibly beautiful Cathedral with 3 parts with baroque architecture built of quarry stone.  The interior is even more beautiful than the exterior - don\'t forget to look up and see the incredible oil paintings on the ceilings and visit the baroque style alters - each equally beautiful although in different styles and moods.

430122928.name: Beautiful Cathedral in Downtown Saltillo
430122928.author: a TripAdvisor user
430122928.reviewBody: The stonework and detail are amazing! Worth at walk around both inside and out. It is very interesting to see how the building was added on to and the architecture changed over the years.

389079080.name: Just another church
389079080.author: a TripAdvisor user
389079080.reviewBody: Nothing special but I was with friends that wanted to see the church. It is in a bad area of the city with a lot of homeless people in the area

375229052.name: 17th Century Architecture
375229052.author: a TripAdvisor user
375229052.reviewBody: My friends from Saltillo took me on a tour of downtown for shopping & sightseeing. I was truly amazed at the detail in the stonework at the Cathedral de Santiago de Saltillo.

368449933.name: Evening stroll through Catedral de Santiago de Saltillo - must see
368449933.author: a TripAdvisor user
368449933.reviewBody: Visited the Catedral on way to shopping/dinner in the area. Church is on par with a lot of the ones I\'ve toured in Europe (Austria, Germany, etc). The outside is very impressive, but it is when you enter the Catedral when you will be even more impressed. A definite must see in Saltillo.

361024693.name: Breathtaking
361024693.author: a TripAdvisor user
361024693.reviewBody: What a beautiful church. A must when visiting Saltillo. Everything you would expect in a Cathedral and more.

354440947.name: Architectural gem of saltillo!
354440947.author: a TripAdvisor user
354440947.reviewBody: This cathedral in the centro historico is a gem in the heart of saltillo. It is a combination of barroque  neoclassic and churriguresq style. Altar of san jose is adorned with silver work.\nMost distinctive building of Saltillo!

334647467.name: Nice
334647467.author: a TripAdvisor user
334647467.reviewBody: We went there two times because the first time we went it was night time and it was closed so we had to go back the next morning but it was worth it.

302679728.name: Can\'t miss it!
302679728.author: a TripAdvisor user
302679728.reviewBody: You can\'t miss it if you\'re downtown. It has beautiful colonial architecture, a must see. The inside is pretty amazing too.

295122660.name: Baroque
295122660.author: a TripAdvisor user
295122660.reviewBody: I agree, the outside architecture is something special. It\'s full of details to admire. A truly piece of art. The inside is simple, let\'s say it doesn\'t capture all the beauty from the exterior.

290898243.name: very nice classic Latin Cathedral
290898243.author: a TripAdvisor user
290898243.reviewBody: Nice and well preserved church. Nice architecture and stained glass. Many small restaurants nearby. Visit in the morning for best light, in my opinion.

278544243.name: Nice basic cathedral
278544243.author: a TripAdvisor user
278544243.reviewBody: A nice cathedral. If you are in town, I would definitely recommend going to spend a few moments inside.\n\nNot overly ornate as many of these places can be.

268426052.name: Catholic church
268426052.author: a TripAdvisor user
268426052.reviewBody: They have a beautiful entrance and door, and the altar has many artistic work. At 12 oclock, the bells tower play the angelus tune,

262126464.name: Very nice view from the outside
262126464.author: a TripAdvisor user
262126464.reviewBody: I have driven by many times, stopped and visited a number of times as well.  worth a visit if you are nearby.

255688799.name: A beautiful barroque church
255688799.author: a TripAdvisor user
255688799.reviewBody: It is always nice to find yet another barroque church in wherever place you visit in Mexico. Saltillo is no exception and you can view the maginificent building of Catedral de Santiago. The advantage is that from this place, you can find museums, shops, restaurants, and park very very close.

234117668.name: Nice three-in-one little church.
234117668.author: a TripAdvisor user
234117668.reviewBody: Was nice and interesting. Went to a wedding, Its like 3 chapels that make up the whole church. So while you\'re attending a wedding in one chapel you hear the next door chapel\'s "quincea\u00f1era" ceremony in process. You don\'t know if some of the music is for the ceremony you\'re attending or the neighboring ceremony. Interesting, as outside you can see the "quincea\u00f1era", the outcoming bride coming out, and the next bride waiting to come in. Guess there\'s a lot of celebrations going on in there. Which makes it very colorful! Worth your while to see so much festive elegance going on.

205434580.name: Unique cathedral with a variety of arquitectural styles
205434580.author: a TripAdvisor user
205434580.reviewBody: Very small and nothing special inside but worth seeing when in the downtown area. it has several styles

180504126.name: Clean and nice
180504126.author: a TripAdvisor user
180504126.reviewBody: This cathedral buildin is located in hte heart of the city and it has a tower that you can walk up to the bells area, the architecture is atractive, maybe not one of the best cathedrals in Mexico, but it is yet atractive.

177421594.name: Amazingly beautiful!
177421594.author: a TripAdvisor user
177421594.reviewBody: The Cathedral is only the first one of about six or seven churches in downtown Saltillo that you must not miss. Right on the main square, across from Government Palace, it has a very important collection of religious works of art that make you feel like you\'re in somewhere in Europe. Right on the entrance, to the right, you can find an antique copy from the original of Our Lady of Guadalupe, that has been restored, with the history and explanation, that will leave you in awe. The Santo Cristo Chapel is to the left side of the Cathedral, especially important being the patron saint of the city due to the miracles attributed to this image. The cross holds a relic from the Holy Cross. Look for the brochures about the churches and museums in the downtown area. Lots to see and learn!

169765302.name: What a beautiful place.
169765302.author: a TripAdvisor user
169765302.reviewBody: I used to travel to Saltillo for business. I really enjoyed walking around the town, trying different places to eat. The cathedral is the crowning glory though. I spent lots of time just wandering around, taking pictures, and wondering in amazement at this beautiful monument to Christianity. Worth the trip.

169665422.name: The Cathedral
169665422.author: a TripAdvisor user
169665422.reviewBody: Nice place to visit for families, the main celebration for this chapel is on August the 6th. Fire works are lit and lots of vendors to buy handcrafts

165843214.name: Go to the Santo Cristo Chapel
165843214.author: a TripAdvisor user
165843214.reviewBody: The Chapel is next to the Cathedral, in fact is part of it, and the interiors are bautiful. I would say is the most beautiful church in Saltillo, and it is a "must go" if you are on the area.

156293071.name: oldest and prettiest cathedral in northern mexico
156293071.author: a TripAdvisor user
156293071.reviewBody: it looks like its being restored in some parts but the outside of the cathedral, in my opinion, is the most interesting in northern mexico.

152441079.name: amazing structure
152441079.author: a TripAdvisor user
152441079.reviewBody: Located on the town square (city park). Beautiful surroundings and local shopping nearby. Local people relaxing on surrounding benches talking and feeding the birds.

150706753.name: Second oldest church in town
150706753.author: a TripAdvisor user
150706753.reviewBody: A Baroque style church used daily for prayers.  It was renovated in later years. The different styles are visible in the extensions. It is open to visitors to walk through and take pictures. It has a small curio shop. It is a bit odd to take pictures when somebody is inside praying.

133658254.name: Nice place to visit in free weekend
133658254.author: a TripAdvisor user
133658254.reviewBody: There are no many place to see in Saltillo, so if you are in business travel, and have free weekend / time, this place might be nice to visit.\nIn case and you are there, try to get up to the roof where you can see the reflection of the in front square through the smallest window crack.

132197566.name: Beautiful, must visit.
132197566.author: a TripAdvisor user
132197566.reviewBody: Doesn\'t matter what faith you are it is a beautiful sight. It is located in the heart of downtown which is also beautiful in its own \'old rustic\' Mexico feel.

127603790.name: Very Beautiful Chruch
127603790.author: a TripAdvisor user
127603790.reviewBody: Must see if in Saltillo, we met a guys outside the chruch who gave us a tour of the bell tower. Totally awsome view of the city, see pics attached.

126557908.name: Pretty during the day and night
126557908.author: a TripAdvisor user
126557908.reviewBody: Went to a wedding here so it didn\'t get much better.  Pretty spectacular cathedral and even prettier at night.

124075957.name: amazing colonial place
124075957.author: a TripAdvisor user
124075957.reviewBody: a lot history and tradition. since the conquerors till day present

121718906.name: Beautiful inside and out!
121718906.author: a TripAdvisor user
121718906.reviewBody: Beautiful carved doors. The interior was beautiful as well. It was a holiday (Guadalupe) so many people were visiting.  Well worth a visit!

14719529.name: Spanish Colonial Heart of Saltillo\u00b4s Plaza de las Armas
14719529.author: a TripAdvisor user
14719529.reviewBody: The Cathedral of Santiago is the Spanish colonial heart of Saltillo\u00b4s  traditional main square, Plaza de las Armas. This is the perfect place to begin a tour of the city. The Cathedral sits on the eastern corner faced by the Government Palace to the west. The Government Palace has clean public restrooms as well as an informative presentation on the history of the city.  To the north, is the central mercado and to the south is a coffee shop with wi-fi access, ICOCULT bookstore & art gallery. When the tourist information booth is not in the plaza, one can find information about museums, the tourist trolley and cultural events at the bookstore.  South of the Cathedral is Saltillo\u00b4s Casino where the elite of Saltillo, since the days of Benito Juarez, still socialize.  If you ask the staff politely (best in Spanish) they may give you a tour of this lovely period building.  Behind the coffee shop and across the street from the Casino is Alliance Francais for those people that might be interested in seeing French cine on their visit to M\u00e9xico. Bienvenue - Bienvenido - Welcome to Saltillo!

446343523.name: The Old mansion of downtown
446343523.author: a TripAdvisor user
446343523.reviewBody: This house was propierty of William Purcell, and we can admire the ambition and wealth of the irishman, who made Saltillo a prosperous town

210961262.name: Saltillo\'s Art Scene
210961262.author: a TripAdvisor user
210961262.reviewBody: If you are interested in art, you definitely should visit Casa Purcell. Casa Purcell has art mostly from Saltillo residents. I like to visit as often as possible so I can see what\'s new. You will find different sections/rooms with different artists\' work. My favorite time I went was when they drew on all of the white walls with black chalk. Amazing! You can drop by Casa Purcell and then go next door to Banco Purcell or vice versa to learn about the history of the place.

486504329.name: I\'m Not Big on Museums - But this was Worth the Time
486504329.author: a TripAdvisor user
486504329.reviewBody: The visit was pretty much spur of the moment and because someone in the party wanted to go. I was prepared for a real yawn and was pleasantly surprised by the depth of what was offered. Well worth going.

446065552.name: The Trully Mexican tradition Museum
446065552.author: a TripAdvisor user
446065552.reviewBody: As a critisized and fordbidden tradition, bullfighting was inherated by the spaniard who tamed this lands, and established this tradition that have been active for more than 400 years in Saltillo, the bloody sport has his hot spot in the museum, also you can drink coffee on the lobby.

415854163.name: interesting.
415854163.author: a TripAdvisor user
415854163.reviewBody: would have liked to have been able to buy posters/etc. Was interesting to see an overall history of the sport

652648922.name: Lugar de tradicion al visitar Saltillo.
652648922.author: a TripAdvisor user
652648922.reviewBody: Tiene un origen que se remonta a la fecha de la fundaci\u00f3n de Saltillo, cuando las tropas al mando del capit\u00e1n Alberto del Canto fundaron la Villa de Santiago del Saltillo en 1555, cuando en las expediciones ten\u00edan como punto de reuni\u00f3n en el venero de agua que surge al pie de las escalinatas donde esta una peque\u00f1a capillita, donde pueden llenar recipientes con agua siempre fresca que es considerada bendita.\nEl ingresar a la parroquia, se respira tranquilidad, de una arquitectura sencilla, pero que invoca a un ambiente de historia, y sobre todo paz espiritual.\nSe festeja al cristo del ojo de agua creo el tercer domingo del mes de septiembre, con gran verbena. Otro tractivo es en semana santa donde se hace el viacrucis que termina el punto llamado el mirador. recomiendo su visita

itemReviewed.name: La Parroquia del Santo Cristo del Ojo de Agua

627313577.name: Si quieren conocer el lugar exacto donde se fund\u00f3 la ciudad ...aqu\u00ed es
627313577.author: a TripAdvisor user
627313577.reviewBody: Oficialmente Saltillo fu\u00e9 fundado por Alberto del Canto en 1577, pero fueron los Tlaxcaltecas los que descubrieron el ojo de agua (el Saltillo), en este lugar y es accesible para todo aquel que lo quiera conocer, ya sea local o for\u00e1neo. La iglesia est\u00e1 justo a unos escalones m\u00e1s arriba y es una iglesia muy visitada por los feligreses, sobre todo en septiembre cuando es la fiesta patronal, y el viernes santo cuando se realiza el m\u00e1s tradicional de los viacrucis vivientes de la ciudad

itemReviewed.name: La Parroquia del Santo Cristo del Ojo de Agua

504742302.name: Non solo una chiesa
504742302.author: a TripAdvisor user
504742302.reviewBody: Su questo rilievo nasce e si sviluppa lo sforzo missionario nella zona. E\' una chiesa antica e molto bella che si raggiunge attraverso un arco e una scalinata. L\'intero complesso \u00e8 una parrocchia che offre, tra l\'altro, una spettacolare vista sulla citt\u00e0, L\'elemento pi\u00f9 particolare e la sorgente di acqua venerata alla quale si accede attraverso una piccola cappella all\'inizio della scalinata sulla sinistra e nella quale si trova l\'immgine votiva del Santo Cristo del Ojo de Agua. Da non perdere.

itemReviewed.name: La Parroquia del Santo Cristo del Ojo de Agua

594104044.name: A perfect park to enjoy the nature of the Mexican Northeast
594104044.author: a TripAdvisor user
594104044.reviewBody: It is a very well structured park to enjoy calmly a family outing. It has large trees and also has a garden of cactuses.

523246636.name: World class museum
523246636.author: a TripAdvisor user
523246636.reviewBody: This museum has been put together with the most current trends in museums from around the world. It showcases the history of the State of Coahuila.

671659534.name: Mucha historia
671659534.author: a TripAdvisor user
671659534.reviewBody: Es uno de mis museos preferidos es la segunda ocasi\u00f3n que acudo. Te hacen un recorrido muy ameno donde aprendes mucho de la historia de M\u00e9xico y de sus presidentes Coahuilenses. El material expuesto es muy bueno algunas son reliquias. Es un lugar muy cuidado, limpio y se exceden en amabilidad. Es gratuito, en verdad el patronato a hecho una gran labor.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

621834410.name: Aprender historia en forma amena
621834410.author: a TripAdvisor user
621834410.reviewBody: De manera amena podemos conocer pasajes de nuestra historia; un museo peque\u00f1o pero no por ello aburrido.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

548638562.name: Muy interesante
548638562.author: a TripAdvisor user
548638562.reviewBody: Excelente museo.  Muy modern, bien acondicionado.  Excelente tematica y material expuesto. Muy recomendable

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

508237321.name: Cultura Coahuilense
508237321.author: a TripAdvisor user
508237321.reviewBody: Es una excelente opci\u00f3n para conocer un poco de la importancia y personajes destacados de Coahuila, a trav\u00e9s de los 5 presidentes (Melchor Muzquiz, Francisco I. Madero, Venustiano Carranza, Eulalio Guti\u00e9rrez y Roque Gonz\u00e1les.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

497987284.name: Visita nuestros museos
497987284.author: a TripAdvisor user
497987284.reviewBody: Uno de tantos museos de saltillo nos ayuda a aprender de nuestra historia abierto martes a domingo .\n

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

456041516.name: muy buen museo
456041516.author: a TripAdvisor user
456041516.reviewBody: Excelente planeaci\u00f3n del museo, instalaciones muy modernas, limpio, muy interesante y recomendable sin duda.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

415711154.name: peque\u00f1o con algunas fotografias interesantes
415711154.author: a TripAdvisor user
415711154.reviewBody: el lugar es peque\u00f1o con fotografias de buena calidad, es una visita muy rapida, pero esta cerca el museo de las aves, catedral, templo de san juan nepomuseno, si vas a visitar el centro de saltillo puedes hacer estas escalas rapidamente

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

393743991.name: Interessante
393743991.author: a TripAdvisor user
393743991.reviewBody: O museu \u00e9 pequeno, mas \u00e9 muito bonito e interessante. Al\u00e9m de ser gratuito, durante as f\u00e9rias escolares oferece atividades para as crian\u00e7as.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

355652717.name: No me gust\u00f3
355652717.author: a TripAdvisor user
355652717.reviewBody: No me gust\u00f3 el museo lleno de fotos con malos montajes sobrepuestos en las mismas; lo \u00fanico bueno son algunos detalles de historia ciertos que est\u00e1n ah\u00ed...

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

340986889.name: Un gran museo
340986889.author: a TripAdvisor user
340986889.reviewBody: El Museo de los Presidentes es un recinto cultural muy importante para la Historia de Coahuila. Felicidades a sus administradores por el excelente trabajo que realizan

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

333424724.name: Una lecci\u00f3n de historia
333424724.author: a TripAdvisor user
333424724.reviewBody: Entr\u00e9 sin pensar que iba a encontrar tanta infromaci\u00f3n interesante. Pas\u00e9un par de horas en la visita, hay videos y actividades interactivas, Dos personas que trabajan en el museo me acompa\u00f1afron en el recorrdio aportando datos muy interesantes.  Me gust\u00f3 la visita, Para los amantes de la historia,

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

300081560.name: Un buen lufar para conocer la historia de Coahuila
300081560.author: a TripAdvisor user
300081560.reviewBody: es un lugar muy recomendable para aquellos que quieren conocer un poco de la historia de Coahuila, instalaciones nuevas e interactivas, esta muy recomendable para ninos mayores de 9 anos.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

288716781.name: Un recorrido por la historia de Coahuila
288716781.author: a TripAdvisor user
288716781.reviewBody: Es un museo que aparenta estar peque\u00f1o pero entras y vas recorriendo cada espacio y para cuando acuerdas se fue el tiempo. Es un Museo rico en datos y pasajes de los Coahuilenses que han llegado a ser Presidentes de la Rep\u00fablica. Te encuentras con informaci\u00f3n sorprendente, por ejemplo en una vitrina est\u00e1 la primera banda presidencial de Guadalupe Victoria cuyo nombre real era Miguel Fernandez.....Si te gusta la Historia este es un buen lugar...

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

287473344.name: Peque\u00f1o y Limpio
287473344.author: a TripAdvisor user
287473344.reviewBody: a pesar de que el museo se encontraba casi vac\u00edo, nos toco visitarlo por accidente, me di cuenta que a pesar de que la persona que lo atend\u00eda era un adulto mayor y no hab\u00eda nadie m\u00e1s en el museo supusimos que era el quien lo atend\u00eda de todo a todo, me gusto porque  es un hotel no tan lleno de letras, mucho lo refleja en imagenes y fotograf\u00edas que alfinal puedes tomarte una foto en una silla presidencial (ovbiamente falsa) pero es un atractivo muy bueno.\nUn museo muy limpio.

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

250056237.name: excelente museo
250056237.author: a TripAdvisor user
250056237.reviewBody: otro de los museos en el centro de saltillo los cuales pueden ser visitados sin necesidad de trasladarse en vehiculo, peque\u00f1o recinto pero al igual que los dem\u00e1s perfectamente atendido y con buen acervo

address.streetAddress: Bravo y de la Fuente, Zona Centro

651522155.name: Interesante
651522155.author: a TripAdvisor user
651522155.reviewBody: Te cuentan la historia de la calavera garbancera, de Guadalupe Posada, que luego fue bautizada como La Catrina por Diego Rivera.\nCuenta con una estaci\u00f3n de radio por internet y es bastante interesante.

616348240.name: A mis hijos les encant\u00f3.
616348240.author: a TripAdvisor user
616348240.reviewBody: El lugarcito tiene una peque\u00f1a exhibici\u00f3n que toca partes muy t\u00edpicas de las antiguas leyendas de Saltillo, sin duda es un destino entretenido para ni\u00f1os y j\u00f3venes, el precio es verdaderamente bajo, vale la pena visitarla.

582516582.name: mini museo
582516582.author: a TripAdvisor user
582516582.reviewBody: Se encuentra a espaldas del museo de las aves, pregunta por los costos antes de ingresar. Es peque\u00f1o bonitas exposiciones y lo rescatable del lugar es la explicaci\u00f3n de sus voluntarios con respecto al lugar.

577688104.name: Si te gustan las Catrinas no dejes de ir
577688104.author: a TripAdvisor user
577688104.reviewBody: MI expectativa no era alta sin embargo salimos muy contentos de la experiencia. Muy recomendable si el tema te gusta. los gu\u00edas dan muy buena informaci\u00f3n. La decoraci\u00f3n y ambientaci\u00f3n excelente

575753147.name: Un lugar muy original
575753147.author: a TripAdvisor user
575753147.reviewBody: El museo es peque\u00f1o pero est\u00e1 bien dise\u00f1ado y cuidan mucho los detalles. Nos toc\u00f3 escuchar unas leyendas de la ciudad narradas de una manera muy original. Visita obligada si viajas a Saltillo.

565348762.name: MUY BIEN EXPLICADO, MUY PEQUE\u00d1O Y COSTO ALTO
565348762.author: a TripAdvisor user
565348762.reviewBody: El costo incluye explicaci\u00f3n por parte del propietario, interesante por su contenido y alegr\u00eda.\nLa explicaci\u00f3n de los autores y creador de las catrinas, su historia, evoluci\u00f3n y cantidad de visitantes. Lo pone en una categor\u00eda necesaria para ser vicsitado

671667766.name: Me gusta esta plaza
671667766.author: a TripAdvisor user
671667766.reviewBody: Es una plaza agradable y c\u00f3moda. Con suficiente estacionamiento y seguridad. Lugares para comer, muchas maquinas de mu\u00f1elocos y adem\u00e1s siempre que hemos ido en s\u00e1bado tienen show para ni\u00f1os. Hay cine y encuentras lo que buscas. El clima es agradable y la plaza y ba\u00f1os limpios.

659517359.name: Agradable
659517359.author: a TripAdvisor user
659517359.reviewBody: Bonito lugar lleno de colorido en sus estancias, bastantes locales con variedad de productos y un amplio comedor con rica comida a escoger

653499422.name: Me gusta
653499422.author: a TripAdvisor user
653499422.reviewBody: La verdad le doy buena calificaci\u00f3n porque fue de las primeras plazas en saltillo.ya la dejaron caer.pero sigue viva.falta m\u00e1s publicidad y atraer m\u00e1s  tiendas y realizar actividades para la sana convivencia.tiene lo b\u00e1sico para visitarlos.hay que hecharle m\u00e1s ganas!!!

380711466.name: Sencilla, peque\u00f1a, encuentras lo que buscas
380711466.author: a TripAdvisor user
380711466.reviewBody: No es de lujo no hay tiendas de marcas de prestigio salvo Cimaco pero en general hay comidas r\u00e1pidas un cine, recomendable para perder el tiempo.

350124794.name: Sencillo
350124794.author: a TripAdvisor user
350124794.reviewBody: Plaza peque\u00f1a . Tiene un s\u00faper mercado. Comida r\u00e1pida y un cine. No es de lujo . es sencilla y bien peque\u00f1ita. Hay un apple bs por el estacionamiento o parqueo.

332104756.name: Excelente ubicaci\u00f3n, le hacen falta m\u00e1s atracciones y negocios
332104756.author: a TripAdvisor user
332104756.reviewBody: Es una plaza comercial con mucho potencial ya que se encuentra en una locaci\u00f3n inmejorable, pero le hacen falta m\u00e1s atracciones. Sin embargo es un buen lugar para ir a comer, pasear y divertirse. Recomiendo comer un Elote Real o una nieve Natural Es.

324290634.name: Pequeno, bom para comida r\u00e1pida
324290634.author: a TripAdvisor user
324290634.reviewBody: Plaza Real \u00e9 um pequeno shopping, conta com um supermercado, algumas poucas lojas e uma pra\u00e7a de alimenta\u00e7\u00e3o. Para comida r\u00e1pida (almo\u00e7o etc) tem v\u00e1rias op\u00e7\u00f5es (fast-food chineses, hamburgueria, sorveteria etc). O estacionamento \u00e9 gr\u00e1tis.

619253405.name: Muy divertido
619253405.author: a TripAdvisor user
619253405.reviewBody:
El museo de la Katrina es un espacio muy pequeño, pero me encanto cada detalle que tienen con uno.
 llegas y te ponen una pelicula de terror, al terminar ya con algo de miedo te dan un recorrido por las instalaciones, tienen mucha cultura de la zona, gran variedad de articulos referente a las catrinas y las historia.
Y al final terminan el recorrido contandote leyendas de la ciudad de Saltillo, acompañado con un chocolate caliente y pan dulce.

Me encanto, lo recomiendo mucho como cultura de la ciudad y para realizar actividades diferentes de vez en cuando!

563619023.name: Museo o Casa abierta?
563619023.author: a TripAdvisor user
563619023.reviewBody:
De acuerdo a mi entendido, los dueños del lugar son creadores de Catrinas hechas de papel mache, lo cual hace que la exposición muestre mucha de su obra.

Por momentos, recordé una visita a la Casa Azul, antigua vivienda de Frida en Coyoacán.

Evite confusiones, VISITE y opine.

Me quedo con sus dibujos, la explicación de los "chavos" y un monton de objetos de antaño que hacen de este lugar, algo diferente.

533562046.name: No es lo mismo un museo a una galer\u00eda
533562046.author: a TripAdvisor user
533562046.reviewBody: Este museo cuenta con 2 "museos" el de las mu\u00f1ecas y el de la Catrina, el principal problema es que ninguno de los dos deber\u00eda calificar como museo, ya que es muy diferente exhibir material exponiendo su fondo que presentar obras de arte propias. \n\nEs un atractivo verlo, pero no califica como museo, adem\u00e1s mucha de su informaci\u00f3n es terriblemente inexacta.

651365644.name: Nice weekend diversion
651365644.author: a TripAdvisor user
651365644.reviewBody: This is a unique museum not far from the center of town, a short and cheap Uber ride away. You\u2019ll see the historic and prehistoric artifacts of this region, including fossils, old crafts and tools, and even a boxcar. They also have live animals, from turtles and snakes, to rams and even bears. For a bit extra you can see the animatronic dinosaur exhibit, worth seeing.

646343943.name: Great museum
646343943.author: a TripAdvisor user
646343943.reviewBody: One of the best museums in the northen area of Mexico. totally recomended for family trips. Be sure to eat well first, not the best options inside.

643644627.name: Nice and educational variety of exhibitions for all ages
643644627.author: a TripAdvisor user
643644627.reviewBody: This museum has a combination of fossils exhibits, live animals, educational videos, and natural science facts with uncomplicated explanations. People of all ages can enjoy a visit of this museum and learn about fossils found in Mexico, climate facts and how the different deserts are found around the globe as well as their respective plants and fauna. A small collection of live animals, great exhibits of serpents, and nice collection of cactus and other desert plants.\nThe only downside in my opinion is separate the cost of the parking and the entrances, but it is worth it the prices.\nAt the end, you leave the place with a significant knowledge of prehistoric era, deserts, animals and plants habitats from some arid areas of Mexico. It also makes you conscious of the ambient and the consequences of the human negligence.

642978731.name: Amazing
642978731.author: a TripAdvisor user
642978731.reviewBody:
We thought it was expensive, but when we saw the perfect conditions the animals have we realized we underpaid.

The information provided during the tour was actually new and exceptional. Besides, some areas are interactive, so you could saw a bunch of 30's something acting like kids.

It is interesting, clean, a pleasant surprise and the animals are so cute, you can't miss it.

596246483.name: Wonderful miseum
596246483.author: a TripAdvisor user
596246483.reviewBody: We hadn\u2019t been to this museum for over three years and were glad to see that it had changed considerably with new exhibits. Don\u2019t miss this museum whenever you are near or in Saltillo!

594102840.name: One of the best museums in M\u00e9xico
594102840.author: a TripAdvisor user
594102840.reviewBody: Museo del Desierto is certainly a great place to visit in Saltillo. Very rich in natural history, the museography is extraordinary and very well organised. Its is perfect place to visit with children because it offers an amazing collection of fossils and dinosaurs remains.

576362759.name: World class museum
576362759.author: a TripAdvisor user
576362759.reviewBody: It looks like this museum was established in the 1990s and the presentation, signage, and variety of and breath of the plants, animals, and equipment presented is excellent. Besides cactus, dinosaur skeletal structures, and equipment that might be used in the desert, there are live animals on the grounds. There are a variety of ways people can become engaged such as a preparatory Immersion section at the entrance, films, and it is just fun to stroll through the museum learning as much as one wishes.

564098285.name: Brilliant
564098285.author: a TripAdvisor user
564098285.reviewBody: This place is just great, there is so much to see. It really is a must for a couple of hours if you are in Saltillo. All the animals looked really well treated & healthy. The balck bear is great.

562514750.name: Something for Everyone
562514750.author: a TripAdvisor user
562514750.reviewBody: This museum has something for everyone. Several very nice large dinosaurs, local wildlife, cultural exhibits, and some live animals in nicely done outdoor habitats.

561086799.name: Very interesting
561086799.author: a TripAdvisor user
561086799.reviewBody: The museum is a drive away from the centre of town, and gives great views of the area from the car park. The museum gives an interesting overview of the climate, fauna and geology of Mexico as well as some great dinosaur skeletons. There is a great collection of reptiles and insects too, although the tanks were small. We spent 2 or three hours there and could have spent longer, it was really fun!

556098070.name: Interesting!
556098070.author: a TripAdvisor user
556098070.reviewBody:
I wasn't expecting much from this museum, since it is focused on "deserts".
 But I was really impressed as I walked through the different sections.

It is a big museum, so make sure you have at least 3 hours to make this visit. 

Some of the things you will see: what are deserts and their role, culture and society in deserts, dinosaurs, desert animals, a small zoo with live animals (bears, wolves,  bighorn sheep, snakes and more).

One of the best museums you will find in Saltillo.

529462001.name: You don\'t need to speak Spanish to visit this museum - LOVED IT
529462001.author: a TripAdvisor user
529462001.reviewBody: We had a ball at this museum.  Lots of great exhibits, very well put together.  You definitely need no less than two hours to see everything.

526641530.name: Excellent, allow minimum 2 hours
526641530.author: a TripAdvisor user
526641530.reviewBody: Huge variety of live animals, a detailed  exhibition on peyote, loads of info about the animals of the desert, trex at the entrance - really excellent. I had 2 hours there and was rushing to see everything. \n\nNote that almost everything is in Spanish only

524142982.name: excellent museum
524142982.author: a TripAdvisor user
524142982.reviewBody: A museum at the height of many, grand exhibits, friendly people and the best bears playing in the waterfall.\nHighly recommend

515508290.name: Comprehensive museum
515508290.author: a TripAdvisor user
515508290.reviewBody: Went to the museum and spent a fascinating couple of hours looking at the many displays. This modern museum offered everything from dinosaurs to live animals.  Definitely worth a visit.

505300777.name: Bigger than expended, really well done, no English
505300777.author: a TripAdvisor user
505300777.reviewBody:
My wife and I took a day trip to Saltillo, and this is the main attraction and the "must see" of Saltillo. It was really well done! Well organized, well put together, good mixture of displays, info, interactive, etc. We spent about 3 hours total, including a quick lunch. Which, by the way, if you are in a rush, or forget to eat before, the small restaurant was fine. Good hamburger (only burger, hot dog, or panini with fries for lunch). Also some snack areas around the museum. 

We read a review of someone who found a English speaking guide. $250MX for a guide, however there were no English guides the day we went. All signs in Spanish (google translate is legit - use camera and hold up to sign and translate in real time on your screen). 

Live animals out back. Nothing special, if anything a little sad for the small exhibits.

504474678.name: Nice
504474678.author: a TripAdvisor user
504474678.reviewBody: Went with a group of 19 friends who came from the USA to visit. It was a nice tour. Tuesday the price is reduced greatly. None of the signs explaining the things are in English but the folks enjoyed it.

503681677.name: Good place
503681677.author: a TripAdvisor user
503681677.reviewBody:
Good to visit once with family
Part of it is a zoo, it has dinosaurs and other animals 
Is cheap and last like 3 hours

496830738.name: great place to visit
496830738.author: a TripAdvisor user
496830738.reviewBody: make sure you visit this place is a great museum, they will explain all about the desert and some things about the dinosaurs, also the have some live animals representing the desert area.

493070024.name: First world class Museum
493070024.author: a TripAdvisor user
493070024.reviewBody: It is a very nice Museum, the exhibitions are great, the place it is totally a great Dessert experience, so you will spend a great time with the family and will have the opportunity to see live animals, like wolves, snakes, and prairie dogs.\nIf you visit Saltillo, this is a "Must to" in the stay in this city.

490195127.name: Jorge
490195127.author: a TripAdvisor user
490195127.reviewBody: The museum is a jewel in the showcase for Saltillo..\nSaltillo\u200b is very lucky to have the quality and professionalizm of a staff working at the museum that it has there. Hello Nacho!\nAlso very nice gift shop...

489718793.name: Very interesting and unique experience. Recommend.
489718793.author: a TripAdvisor user
489718793.reviewBody: We were on a long business trip and visited most sites in and around Saltillo. I remember this place as one of the more unique and worthwhile visit. I guess being a bit of a paleontology fan also helped. But seriously, it\'s a great place to take your family and kids.

487225186.name: Deserto e Dinosauri, merita una visita
487225186.author: a TripAdvisor user
487225186.reviewBody:
During a company conference we had an half day break within the visit to this museum.

I found it very well organized and actractive. I would suggest for family with children (unfortunately I was with old collegues....)

I would like to thank you our guide that she speaks a fluent english and had described to us history and nice interestic topic nicely.

484923153.name: Not great for weddings
484923153.author: a TripAdvisor user
484923153.reviewBody: My friend got married here and its not an elegant place to get married there. The service was good and statues were pretty for pictures

480657019.name: Great museum, but the zoo is very sad
480657019.author: a TripAdvisor user
480657019.reviewBody: The museum is very interesting, with topics ranging from the dinosaur fossils found there, to the native populations, to the Mexican Revolution. Very nice layout and well-curated, but the zoo is a sad sight to see. They have big, wild animals like bears and wolves and coyotes in small enclosures, if they could get them to a sanctuary, that would be much better than seeing those beautiful animals sad and sleeping all the time!

479290148.name: It\'s a museum and a zoo!!
479290148.author: a TripAdvisor user
479290148.reviewBody:
Great place to check out while in Saltillo! Make sure you can speak/read Spanish or it's not worth the visit. 
Si hablas espanol debes ir!

Don't bother buying a map, once you get inside you just follow the path to the left and there are maps posted throughout the museum. 
After you get done with the museum part you walk through the small but active zoo. Walk up the platforms to make sure you see all of the animals.

453933254.name: Must to visit if you come to Saltillo
453933254.author: a TripAdvisor user
453933254.reviewBody: It\'s the most important atraction for saltillo; the museum is very well maintained and nice exhibitions; skeletons of dinasours are owesome; consider 3 - 4 hours for a complete tour. Parking available.

446636896.name: Ecology Museum
446636896.author: a TripAdvisor user
446636896.reviewBody: The museum is large and all the time is changing and growing.  This is because scientific research bring new story\u00b4s and exhibits every year . The Ecosistem is the unit of interest It\u00b4s a travel in time from Big Bang  to desert live animals.

445932945.name: The best Natural History Musueum in Mexico
445932945.author: a TripAdvisor user
445932945.reviewBody: While other cities have bigger malls and nightlife, Saltillo my town, has The Desert Musueum, a place with the biggest Fossil collection in Mexico, and also it adds the stuffed animal\'s collection of Saltillo, and a full roundabout of the Mexican dessert, first world instalations, and the Perrito de las praderas hatches, make it the best natural History Museum in Mexico

438579691.name: Everybody knwos is great, but try their restaurant
438579691.author: a TripAdvisor user
438579691.reviewBody: I think this museum must get great reviews, I just want to add: Try their restaurant near the entrance. It is just amazing. Great vegetarian choices. The service may be slow, but the wait is worth it

432265819.name: Tire shop owner
432265819.author: a TripAdvisor user
432265819.reviewBody: No words to explain, excelent place. Specially the outdoors very very nice place to spend entirely day with kids

423003921.name: excellent natutal history museum
423003921.author: a TripAdvisor user
423003921.reviewBody: we went on a family field trip to visit while we stayed at the beautiful city of saltillo so much history in this place specially dinasaurs species native to the state we visited great place to visit kids had a great time.

419965428.name: Best to do in saltillo
419965428.author: a TripAdvisor user
419965428.reviewBody: Awesome collection that goes from fossils to living creatures and men made artifacts.\nIt\'s a great way to learn about different kind of deserts qnt how we interact with them. Kids just love it

418154180.name: Great place to learn about the dessert and its ecosystem.
418154180.author: a TripAdvisor user
418154180.reviewBody: Great place to bring children as they have some exhibits geared for them. Plan to take a break as it can take a couple of hours to see everything.

415874487.name: Great place to know history of desert
415874487.author: a TripAdvisor user
415874487.reviewBody: This is a great park-museum to know about desert, since dinosaurs found in Coahuila to modern times, including a mini zoo is local fauna. Cactus collection it\'s amazing, there is a greenhouse when you can legally buy local species.

412944386.name: Tuesday is a cheap day
412944386.author: a TripAdvisor user
412944386.reviewBody: Tuesday is the least expensive day to visit. This is a nice museum but not excellent. Signs are in English and Spanish. That\'s all I have to say!

406819636.name: High quality Museum
406819636.author: a TripAdvisor user
406819636.reviewBody:
This museum was established a few years ago, nowadays is an excellent spot to learn about fossils and Northern Mexico's nature.

There are several sections available, one for the fossils that were found in Coahuila, other that shows ancient cultures traditions, another section shows dessert plants, and finally some live animals.

Kids younger than 6 yo don't pay access fee, elder people and students get 50% off.

Totally recommended.

376258814.name: Great spot
376258814.author: a TripAdvisor user
376258814.reviewBody: This was a truly impressive venue for a conference. Great exhibits, beautiful setting. An impressive number of animals on display. The cafe had good food too.

361026267.name: Real Nice
361026267.author: a TripAdvisor user
361026267.reviewBody: Great place to spend a few hours. Affordable for a family. Everything from fossils, bones, animals alive and stuffed. All kinds of history - plants, people, culture. I was lucky to have someone who spoke Spanish with me.

351847049.name: A "don\'t Miss" in Saltillo
351847049.author: a TripAdvisor user
351847049.reviewBody: You need at least an hour to make the museum tour, but several hours could also be easily spent.  Very nice and modern with well planned exhibits.

344150096.name: Sunday outing
344150096.author: a TripAdvisor user
344150096.reviewBody: Great displays. Kids loved it. Would help a lot if you could buy tickets online. Long wait in the sun. Well put together place. Affordable.

335429711.name: Very entertaining and well designed
335429711.author: a TripAdvisor user
335429711.reviewBody: Very beautiful place and prefect for young kids..the showing rooms are very diverse from dinosaurs to real looking animals and the outdoor mini zoo is a plus.

325044922.name: Amazing
325044922.author: a TripAdvisor user
325044922.reviewBody: It is not a incredible museum, but I recommend it. beside the museum it has a zoo a souvenir store. Take your time, you may take 2 hours to do the tour.

302679578.name: A must see!
302679578.author: a TripAdvisor user
302679578.reviewBody: A fun place to visit. Give yourself a few hours because it\'s kind of big. A good mix between a historical museum and zoo like.

295122350.name: Go.
295122350.author: a TripAdvisor user
295122350.reviewBody:
Maybe this museum won't win any museography award... actually there are many things to criticize, BUT I'll recommend it for sure. It's a good place to understand the region. 

There are interactive areas, many things for children and even living species.

The staff is great.

Don't forget to stop by the shops located outside the museum. Many handmade stuff. You will help the locals with your purchase.

Something is granted: you will learn something. Only that, makes worth the visit.

293501091.name: Worth the visit!
293501091.author: a TripAdvisor user
293501091.reviewBody: Expo of local excavation dinosaur research Coahuila region, extremely interesting for adults and kids love it, 2 to 3 hour visit, cafeteria available, one of a kind Museum in the zone and Mexico.

290897800.name: interesting museum on wildlife living in the desert
290897800.author: a TripAdvisor user
290897800.reviewBody: ENjoyed this museum very much.  Many things to see, lots of very good presentation, and some tortoises and prairie dogs out back to watch and see. THis is a modern museum, with the exhibits designed very well.

286982035.name: Unbelievable
286982035.author: a TripAdvisor user
286982035.reviewBody:
This is one of the most beautifull and complete nature museum in the world. It contains 4 pavillions.

Pavillion I: The desert. This shows how it came about, it’s original inhabitants (dinosaurs) and it’ evolution.

Pavillion II: Desert and man. How man succeeded in living in the desert. It also describes rituals and customs of the first inhabitants of this region.

Pavillion III: Evolution and bio-diversity. Here we see the different animals that first lived in this environment and how the evolved. For example, from mamouth to elephant. From saber tooth tiger to today’s version.

Pavillion IV: The laboratory of life. Here we see how Coahuila was 70 million years from today. Mexico has the most diversity of reptiles in the world. We see some of them live: Snakes, turtles, lizards. Other animals are also presented in habitats that resemble the wild: wolves, bears, bighorn sheep etc.

If in Monterrey or Saltillo, this museum is a must.

286601564.name: Amazing, amazing and amazing.
286601564.author: a TripAdvisor user
286601564.reviewBody: If you are a dinosaur enthusiast you should not miss this. (If you have been to other countries science or natural history museums you may not be amazed) may be the best natural history museum in Mexico. Definitely a must if you are familiar and excited about dinosaurs. The area is full of unique fossils that make this museum quite unique.

286046003.name: Fantastic museum, a must for families visiting Saltillo.
286046003.author: a TripAdvisor user
286046003.reviewBody: Very reasonable prices. Better visiting during the week when children are still in school. Other wise, it can get too crowded. Nice little gift shop, and exhibits are pretty impresive! From a linx to a prairy dog colony, it sure does entertains the kids! and it is my understanding that a wolf was just borned a couple fo months ago, so wait for that exhibit to re-open in the near future.

285799189.name: Museo del Desierto is an excellent spot
285799189.author: a TripAdvisor user
285799189.reviewBody: I liked the view from the parking lot. The exhibits were informative. My children enjoyed themselves. There are some animals on exhibit, and some fossils. The desert garden with turtles was very relaxing.

282040398.name: A Real Find
282040398.author: a TripAdvisor user
282040398.reviewBody: This attraction is fun for the whole family. Here is an informative combination of natural history museum and zoo. \nTake along comfortable walking shoes. \nThe cheerful bilingual young student guides will explain most of the natural history exhibits.

273081462.name: First rate museum
273081462.author: a TripAdvisor user
273081462.reviewBody:
Really big, but there is no real food to buy, only snacks. Get in there early so you can be done past noon and go elsewhere to eat (late lunch). There are severañ exhibitions, but the best ones are the one of the dinosaurs and fossils, and the one displaying animals from the region.
There is a zoo with small animals (turtles, snakes, squirrels, etc) and a botanical garden with a wide variety of desert plants.
It´s a really cool museum. Sometimes there´s even activities and crafts for children. You can get fun stuff at the souvenir shop and buy baby cactus.
Entrance fee is about 7 usd per adult.

268423399.name: Excellent museum.
268423399.author: a TripAdvisor user
268423399.reviewBody: I like, the paleontoloic area, the apatosaurio  and the other esqueletons are amazin, the park around the museum has excelent view of the town.

265566390.name: Dinosaurs of the Desert
265566390.author: a TripAdvisor user
265566390.reviewBody: This museum is a very good presentation of prehistoric life in the desert areas of northern Mexico. Until I visited this museum I was not aware of the prehistoric nature of this area.  Tour information is available in English recordings and it is very easy to walk through the area.

262554792.name: Great experience
262554792.author: a TripAdvisor user
262554792.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to visit in Saltillo Mexico, the entrance price is very accessible 90 Mexican pesos per adult.\nThe tourist guide really knows the topics and are always able to assist you. All the rooms are so clean and have a lot of information. Since sea animals to the Big bears and dinosaurs. It has also some live animals (spiders, Rams, snakes, bears, etc). If you have the opportunity to come to Saltillo Mexico the "Museo del Desierto" is a MUST to visit. \nGreat experience!!

262029085.name: Excellent, if you are in the area, and you have the time
262029085.author: a TripAdvisor user
262029085.reviewBody: I have been here 6 or 7 times.  Living in the area, you run out of things to do.  We always enjoy it, and bring friends regularly.

256042133.name: Getting old
256042133.author: a TripAdvisor user
256042133.reviewBody: I have been over 5 times and everytime it looks like is not getting proper maintenance.  We see more closed areas, even some glass floor panels where you walked by are not in service.  Still kids can have good time there but if nothing changes in the next couple of years, it will not be a good destination as it had been on the past

247395081.name: One of the Best I Have Ever Seen
247395081.author: a TripAdvisor user
247395081.reviewBody: 4 Pavillions  covering The Desert Past and Present, Man and the Desert, Biodiversity  and a Botanical Garden this is probably the most complete museum of its kind. Designed for all age groups, it contains exhibits that I have never seen anywhere else. There are too many positives to mention, but I guarantee that you will not be disappointed; and if you go with young children, be prepared to spend the day.

242033113.name: Real dinosaur fossils
242033113.author: a TripAdvisor user
242033113.reviewBody: This is a relatively young museum, it oppened its doors in 1999 and since then has been showing its visitors all the diversity of life that can be found in the dessert of Coahuila, Nuevo Leon and Chihuahua.  The most amazing things to me are the dinosaur fossils they have, you can see the entire museum in less than a day but everything there is very interesting.  Don\'t miss it if you are in Saltillo or Monterrey.

242022270.name: A NICE MUSEUM TO VISIT
242022270.author: a TripAdvisor user
242022270.reviewBody: Well explained, featuring very kind high school students as guides, with interesting exhibitions concerning natural and human history of the desert Mexican lands, and their living ways, from ancient times to the present, this museum is really a must when in Saltillo.

238038477.name: Great Place to visit
238038477.author: a TripAdvisor user
238038477.reviewBody: Wonderful place, excellent service and great collection!!!! We definitely will come back again, my kids loved it all the collection is amazing, you should try to visit on Sunday!!!

237900468.name: del desierto
237900468.author: a TripAdvisor user
237900468.reviewBody: absolutely stunning, modern buildings, a lot to see. wonderful employees.  modest fee. so many things to see. you will not regret your visit.  resist touching the animals !

232772719.name: Ok to fill the day
232772719.author: a TripAdvisor user
232772719.reviewBody: Because of the ranking I thought this museum has to be more than great, but I was disappointed. In my opinion there\'s a concept missing, you go from one room to another switching the times (from fossils to Dinosaurs back to the big bang and than a leap in time to the desert). But the entrance is not that expensive and you can fill the day with a visit.

227142077.name: Great Museum
227142077.author: a TripAdvisor user
227142077.reviewBody: This is a really nice, large museum, allow plenty of time (2-3 hours). Lots of animals to see as well. The dinosaurs exhibits are amazing.

226984707.name: Oasis in the Dessert
226984707.author: a TripAdvisor user
226984707.reviewBody: Located in the Mexican dessert, this ecological Museum provides a great visibility both on nature and resources of the dessert. Great expositions and museography.

223842256.name: Best museum in Coahuila
223842256.author: a TripAdvisor user
223842256.reviewBody: On this place you can found a lot of dinosaurs, and another interesting things founded in the Coahuila\'s dessert.

204060867.name: Beautiful
204060867.author: a TripAdvisor user
204060867.reviewBody: Its a lot bigger than expected we rushed thru it and it took us about two hours, it is very well organized, the presentation is also excelent the only fault was there were no descrptions in English and restroom at the entrance, but well worth the visit to learn the natural history of Coahuila.

198422652.name: World class science museum
198422652.author: a TripAdvisor user
198422652.reviewBody: I went  to the Museo del Desierto for the cacti and succulents, but stayed for the well organized, didactic and interactive exhibitions. The different sections are focused on the all aspects of desert flora, fauna, geology, geomorphology, meteorology as well as human interaction. I was particularly impressed with the dinosaur and fossils exhibitions, and the fact that the exhibit offered a peek into the dinosaur laboratory. The museum also has a small zoo with local wildlife and a reptile collection.

197798485.name: This one took me by surprise.
197798485.author: a TripAdvisor user
197798485.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this very nice museum with my nephew and sister in law. The only thing was nothing was in English and not speaking spanish too well, I felt I missed out on some things. The museum was very nicely presented starting with the Big Bang to dinosaurs, to cave men yo modern day.  There was also good information on the desert.  There was a small artisan area selling items a really reasonable prices. At the end was a small zoo with wolves, bears and other animals. Spent three hours here and really enjoyed. It was 180 pesos for the three of us.

197098791.name: History I didn\'t know existed
197098791.author: a TripAdvisor user
197098791.reviewBody: Unexpected place that holds treasures nowhere else found.\nPieces and 3D fossils over 70 million years old. Very impressive.\nMy favourite part is how the staff told us how they started and survived as a palaeontology team. Hearing all their stories was fascinating.

195180080.name: Waterfalls
195180080.author: a TripAdvisor user
195180080.reviewBody: We visited Saltillo in February 2014 and went to Cola De Caballo it was amazing. The waterfall was breathtaking, the weather was excellent and many BBQ\'s  were scattered about, so take your own food for a great family day out.

191474542.name: Unexpected good
191474542.author: a TripAdvisor user
191474542.reviewBody:
I visited this museum during a business trip in Saltillio during 2010. The town it doesn’t give you the feeling that can have a museum like this. 

The museum is a natural science museum, with different areas of interest. 

The Dinosaur section of the museum is very good organized and it haves a  big variety of exhibits.

Moreover, inside the museum there is a small zoo with the local wild life of Mexican desert. 

I believe that this museum must been seen if you spending some time in Saltillio

169959208.name: Great place to visit
169959208.author: a TripAdvisor user
169959208.reviewBody: This is one of the few museums dedicated to desertic wildlife in northern Mexico. It has lot of cactus species, dinosaurs findings close to Saltillo and a permanent exhibition of precolombinan life in desert Mexico.\nIt is a must to visit in Saltillo.

169651059.name: 1st World Class Museum
169651059.author: a TripAdvisor user
169651059.reviewBody: Come and discover the richiness of the desert in terms of wildlife, come and enjoy it, You can see fossils of dinosaurs and plants from different eras in time that existed in this region of the state. see the "prairie dogs" live in a space prepared cohabiting couple to them, may acquire cactus and desert plants to take with you, wanting the gift shop of the Museum.

165018783.name: One of the best museums I\'ve visited
165018783.author: a TripAdvisor user
165018783.reviewBody: It is not as big as the INAH in Mexico City, but it has a lot of information, dinasour skeletons, train wagons, animals, even some art. It is amazing that a city that\'s not as big as Monterrey or Mexico City, has this kind of attractions. Totally worth it.

158685303.name: Very interesting place to see in Saltillo area
158685303.author: a TripAdvisor user
158685303.reviewBody: It was very nice place to visit during long stay in Saltillo. It takes almost 4 hours to see nearly everything. The exhibition was very interesting. One of the most memorable experiences during  my visit in Saltillo. Generally there is a lot of fascinating things like fossils, animals and plants.

156292799.name: surprising museum in the desert
156292799.author: a TripAdvisor user
156292799.reviewBody: i visited this museum several years back and recently re-visited it and was very surprised by the improvements... featuring coahuila and its desert inhbitants, this museum also highlights its prehistoric past with world class dinosaur exhibits. definitely worth a visit...

152305011.name: Much better then expected
152305011.author: a TripAdvisor user
152305011.reviewBody: Great all round exhibition which will keep all ages interested. Outside there were live animal exhibits as well as a cactus display. Good value too.

150706836.name: Unique museum. One of a kind
150706836.author: a TripAdvisor user
150706836.reviewBody: Survival in the desert and the archeological history of Saltillo over thousands of years depicting evidence of it being under water years before. Interesting fossils of extinct fish and dinosaurs. A bit neglected and in need of funding.

150532179.name: A good afternoon
150532179.author: a TripAdvisor user
150532179.reviewBody: Saltillo did not offer so much fun, but if you wanna pass on good afternoon you can go and visit this museum, well made and keep in good condictio, many rooms to see and tings to do. Very funny the Perros of desert, you can give them food with a special machine, you will enjoy!

137123072.name: Great introduction to the area
137123072.author: a TripAdvisor user
137123072.reviewBody: Well done museum. Many different types of displays from animals/history/cacti. We loved the prairie dogs.

132197536.name: better then expected
132197536.author: a TripAdvisor user
132197536.reviewBody: Locals recommend to visit. Its not bad if you want to kill a couple of hours.

127603226.name: Great Museum to Visit
127603226.author: a TripAdvisor user
127603226.reviewBody: I was really impressed with this Museum, it is sponsered by Chrysler. The place is huge with many different things to see.  They even have a zoo!  Could not beleave this place, highly recommended for a nice afternoon.  Cost was 75 pesso for 1 adult, cheaper for kids. Even had great homemade tacos and shops throughout the museum.

127385297.name: Very interesting
127385297.author: a TripAdvisor user
127385297.reviewBody: This is a very interesting place to visit. The building is clean, open, well organized. The collection is very nice, interesting, attractive. Take some time to see the live animals and plants outdoors.

126557872.name: Amazing fossils
126557872.author: a TripAdvisor user
126557872.reviewBody: Reptile house was excellent and the stuffed animal collection was awesome.  Be aware most signage is in Spanish so get yourself an audio guide at the start.
